steps.title: â€OMWâ€ can mean â€œOn My Way.â€
steps.content: â€OMWâ€ can mean â€œOn My Way.â€ The most common phrase that â€œOMWâ€ stands for is â€œon my way.â€ People often use â€œOMWâ€ to quickly convey that theyâ€™re headed to a specific location. [1] X Research source â€OMWâ€ is used so often as an abbreviation for â€œOn My Way!â€ that Apple has even programmed its devices to autocorrect â€œOMWâ€ to â€œOn my way!â€ [2] X Research source

steps.title: "OMWâ€ can mean â€œOh My Word.â€
steps.content: "OMWâ€ can mean â€œOh My Word.â€ Some people use â€œOMWâ€ as a shorthand for â€œoh my wordâ€ which makes for a less controversial alternative to â€œoh my God.â€ [3] X Research source

steps.title: Text â€œOMWâ€ to tell someone youâ€™re en route.
steps.content: Text â€œOMWâ€ to tell someone youâ€™re en route. Sending someone a quick â€œOMWâ€ is a simple yet helpful way of letting someone know youâ€™re headed towards them. [4] X Research source â€œIn the car. OMW.â€ â€œJust showered, OMW now.â€ â€œOMW. I should be there around 3.â€

steps.title: Use â€œOMWâ€ to hide that youâ€™re running late.
steps.content: Use â€œOMWâ€ to hide that youâ€™re running late. 14 minutes away when you should be 4? Use â€œOMW!â€ Because â€œOMWâ€ is vague and doesnâ€™t include an estimated arrival time (or any other info for that matter), it can help cover your tracks when time gets the better of you. [5] X Research source â€œOMW. But thereâ€™s traffic ğŸ™â€ â€œOMW. See you soon! ğŸ˜„â€ â€œSave me a seat, Iâ€™m OMW!â€

steps.title: Message â€œOMWâ€ instead of â€œOn My Way!â€
steps.content: Message â€œOMWâ€ instead of â€œOn My Way!â€ for a more neutral tone. While their meaning is the same, â€œon my way!â€ has a very different tone than â€œOMW.â€ If youâ€™re going to meet someone in a professional context (or you just donâ€™t want to appear too excited), abbreviating â€œon my wayâ€ and replacing the exclamation point with a period is a safe bet. [6] X Research source To be even more subtle, you can send â€œomwâ€ in all lowercase. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Type â€œOMWâ€ as a shorthand when gaming online.
steps.content: Type â€œOMWâ€ as a shorthand when gaming online. Many believe that â€œOMWâ€ rose to popularity in the early 2000â€™s in the chatrooms of online games like Runescape and World of Warcraft. When players wanted to call for backup but needed their hands on the keyboard to defend their characters, sending â€œOMWâ€ to friends saved them time and points. It could do the same for you! [8] X Research source â€œOMW to your dungeon now! Hold tight!â€ â€œOMW! Can you get him to 50 HP for me?â€ â€œOMW how hard is this boss?â€

steps.title: Punctuate your surprise with â€œOMW.â€
steps.content: Punctuate your surprise with â€œOMW.â€ Since â€œoh my wordâ€ is an alternative for â€œoh my God,â€ use â€œOMWâ€ to convey the same shock you would if you were saying â€œOMG.â€ [9] X Research source â€œOMW youâ€™ll never guess what just happened!â€ â€œOMW this rain is crazy!â€ â€œOMW I did not expect Tony and Sandra to get engaged this soon!â€

steps.title: Use â€œOMWâ€ to vent your anger.
steps.content: Use â€œOMWâ€ to vent your anger. When spelled-out words donâ€™t feel like enough, or they feel too frustrating to type, â€œOMW,â€ like â€œOMG,â€ is an effective way to show someone youâ€™re exasperated over text. [10] X Research source â€œOMW Iâ€™m so sick of these rude customers!â€ â€œOMW! Who does that jerk think he is?!â€ â€œOMW I canâ€™t even ğŸ¤¬ğŸ™„â€

steps.title: Convey excitement with â€œOMW.â€
steps.content: Convey excitement with â€œOMW.â€ Just got a promotion? Your favorite restaurant chain opened up a block from your house? An all-caps â€œOMWâ€ is a perfect exclamation of joy! â€œOMW! GUESS WHO GOT HER DRIVERâ€™S LICENSE?â€ â€œOMW I MADE DEBATE FINALS!â€ â€œOMW! THATâ€™S WONDERFUL! Iâ€™M SO HAPPY FOR YOU!â€

steps.title: Confirm you received their update.
steps.content: Confirm you received their update. If someone texts you â€œOMWâ€ to let you know theyâ€™re in transit towards you, itâ€™s polite to acknowledge you got their message. â€œGot it. Thanks!â€ â€œOkie dokie. See you soon!â€ â€œğŸ‘â€

steps.title: Get more info if theyâ€™re being vague.
steps.content: Get more info if theyâ€™re being vague. If you have a hard deadline or time you need to start and someone only texts you â€œOMW,â€ itâ€™s completely reasonable to ask where they are or for their estimated arrival time. [11] X Research source â€œOkay. Whatâ€™s your ETA?â€ â€œHow far out are ya? I need ya here ASAP!â€ â€œCan you share your location so I know where youâ€™re at?â€

steps.title: Pry a little if the text feels standoffish.
steps.content: Pry a little if the text feels standoffish. If someone is known for texting colorfully with lots of words and emojis, but merely sends you an â€œOMW.â€ message, check in on them. See if thereâ€™s been a relationship rift or if you can help. [12] X Research source â€œOkay. Everything okay?â€ â€œTake your time. Also, Iâ€™m here if you need to talk.â€ â€œGot it. Weâ€™re good, right?â€

steps.title: Give context for the game if itâ€™s an online message.
steps.content: Give context for the game if itâ€™s an online message. If someone is using â€œOMWâ€ during a video game, give them more information about what they might need to enhance their gameplay. [13] X Research source â€œOkay. Itâ€™s a water-type so avoid using fire attacks.â€ â€œGet here soon. We need 5 players to advance to the next level.â€ â€œOkay. Hide your melee weapons! This arena is weird!â€

steps.title: Share their surprise.
steps.content: Share their surprise. Half the fun of a surprise is the personâ€™s reaction. If someone hits you with unexpected news, donâ€™t hide your shock! [14] X Research source â€œNO WAY!â€ â€œSERIOUSLY???? â€œğŸ¤¯ğŸ˜¯â€

steps.title: Listen to their frustrations.
steps.content: Listen to their frustrations. When someone texts â€œOMWâ€ because theyâ€™re angry, the best way to be there for them is to validate their irritations and actively listen to their outrage. They want to be understood and to feel vindicated. [15] X Research source â€œUgh! Thatâ€™s so annoying!â€ â€œSeriously? Iâ€™m so sorry! Iâ€™d be PISSED!â€ â€œWTF? How dare they!â€

steps.title: Match their excitement.
steps.content: Match their excitement. If the tone of an â€œOMWâ€ text is positive, share that texterâ€™s glee with them. Itâ€™ll likely improve both of your moods. â€œGAAAAAHHHHHH! THATâ€™S SO EXCITING!â€ â€œOMW RIGHT BACK AT YA! Iâ€™M SO PROUD OF YOU!â€ â€œWOOHOOOOO! ğŸ‰ğŸ‡ğŸŠâ€

steps.title: Stay on top of new texting slang with these common acronyms.
steps.content: Stay on top of new texting slang with these common acronyms. Learn these popular slang terms to stay in the know and keep your texts looking like English instead of gibberish: BSF : â€œBest sister friendâ€ or â€œbest sibling friendâ€ MMK : â€œMmkayâ€ (a combo of â€œmmâ€ and â€œokayâ€) HB : â€œHeartbroken,â€ â€œhomeboy,â€ or â€œhow â€˜bout?â€ DL : â€œDown lowâ€ ABS : â€œAbsolutelyâ€ WYLL : â€œWhat you look likeâ€ or â€œWhat do you look like?â€ HYB : â€œHow you been?â€ ISTG : â€œI swear to Godâ€
